info.abstract:
[Type] Metadata access.
[Behaviour] Set parameters in a workflow environment.
[Parameters] - key : name of the parameter. It should comply with IEEE Std 1003.1-2001 conventions, unless brackets {} are adopted to refer it; in case "value" has more values, "key" is the array name: use "keys" to list the key to be associated with each value. - keys : similar to "key", but it allows to associate a different key to each value in case of multivalues. - value : value of the parameter. By default it will se to 1. It can be accessed with @key or @{key}. - subset_filter : set to "yes" in case "value" is an index array and subset strings have to be stored on behalf of the list of numbers. Use "real" in case "value" contains real numbers. - offset : expected difference between two consecutive items of input array in case subset_strings have to be evaluated. By default, it will se to "1". - id : workflow identifier. By default the hosting workflow is selected. The target workflow must have been submitted in the same session.
[System parameters] - save : set to "yes" (default) in case output has to be saved remotely.
[Examples] Set the parameter "var" to 10: OPH_TERM: oph_set key=var;value=10; SUBMISSION STRING: "operator=oph_set;key=var;value=10;"
